definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: Not all applications need to be so paranoid.
sentences.chinese: 并不需要对所有的程序都如此偏执。

sentences.english: His theories might be the best display of Taur; being obsessive and realistic.
sentences.chinese: 这也可能正是体现出金牛座的偏执与理性吧。

sentences.english: Above all, an authoritarian state intolerant of dissent and a one-party political system.
sentences.chinese: 专制国家偏执地使用一党专制的政治制度。

sentences.english: Worrying and dwelling on one’s worries is a surefire way of building up paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 焦虑和停留在某人的烦恼上面是一定会造成偏执狂的。

sentences.english: What did my books preach against throughout? Bigotry, violence, struggles for power, no matter what.
sentences.chinese: 我的书反对偏执，暴力，为权力而斗争。

sentences.english: However, let me be paranoid here and draw your attention to the usual disclaimer.
sentences.chinese: 然而，我偏执地猜测，你们通常会放弃或半途而废。

sentences.english: It is a small step in reducing the bigotry of monocultures.
sentences.chinese: 这位减少单一文化的偏执迈出了一小步。

sentences.english: This is not a time to let paranoia chart the course for U.S. policy toward China.
sentences.chinese: 现在决不能让偏执观念左右美国的对华政策。

sentences.english: Do you have paranoid thoughts while travelling on an underground train?
sentences.chinese: 在乘坐地铁的过程当中，你是否有过偏执的想法？

sentences.english: Paranoid Here is a commendatory term, not to mention the fact that this is the case.
sentences.chinese: 偏执狂在这里就是褒义词，何况事实的确如此。

sentences.english: I already said and repeated, that it is an obsessional phantasy.
sentences.chinese: 我已经说过，也一再重复，这是偏执狂的幻见。

sentences.english: We should all have this level of paranoia about input to our programs.
sentences.chinese: 我们大家都应该对我们的程序也有对输入这样的偏执。

sentences.english: Maybe it is not just the heart of Zen, a peaceful and paranoia.
sentences.chinese: 也许这并非禅意，只是心内一种宁和的偏执。

sentences.english: According to medical records, doctors there diagnosed Mr. Chen as paranoid schizophrenic.
sentences.chinese: 根据医疗记录，那里的医生诊断他为精神偏执患者。

sentences.english: Monomania is a prerequisite of success.
sentences.chinese: 成功的第一步即是成为偏执狂。

sentences.english: Japan is also known for its paranoia of foreign diseases.
sentences.chinese: 日本众所周知是一个猜疑外国疾病的偏执狂。

definition: to be strongly attached to/to be dedicated/to cling to
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
